title.narrative: MONITORING CHILDREN RIGHTS

description.narrative: Relevant government institutions have the capacity to monitor the situation of children's rights, analyze public investment for children and expand the effectiveness of social protection programs for children even in situations of humanitarian crisis, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Human Rights Institutions, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2021, the context of social policies is based on a rights-based approach and takes gender differences into account, as well as placing an emphasis on children who suffer exclusion

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant government institutions have the capacity to monitor the situation of children's rights, analyze public investment forchildren and expand the effectiveness of social protection programs for children even in situations of humanitarian crisis

description.narrative: Approximately 4,900 people (1,219 families) benefited from multipurpose cash transfers to support their basic reintegration needs. SIGADENAH was consolidated as its creation was approved by a legislative decree. The creation of DINAF was also approved by legislative decree. The National Policy for Children has been approved by SCGG and SEFIN, paving the way for its promulgation by the Council of Ministers. The National Statistical System (SEN) platform represents an innovation that allows the INE to fulfil its leading role in the production of official statistics and provides a fundamental monitoring tool for a systemic approach, as proposed by SIGADENAH. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/01/2022
